post.description:
Handle conversation requests for the OLS endpoint.

Args:
    llm_request: The request containing a query, conversation ID, and optional attachments.
    auth: The Authentication handler (FastAPI Depends) that will handle authentication Logic.
    user_id: Optional user ID used only when no-op auth is enabled.

Returns:
    Response containing the processed information.

200.description: Query is valid and correct response from LLM is returned

401.description: Missing or invalid credentials provided by client

403.description: Client does not have permission to access resource

500.description: Query can not be validated, LLM is not accessible or other internal error

post.description:
Handle conversation requests for the OLS endpoint.

Args:
    llm_request: The incoming request containing query details.
    auth: The authentication context, provided by dependency injection.
    user_id: Optional user ID used only when no-op auth is enabled.

Returns:
    StreamingResponse: The streaming response generated for the query.

200.description: Query is valid and stream/events from endpoint is returned

schema.title: Response 200 Conversation Request V1 Streaming Query Post

401.description: Missing or invalid credentials provided by client

403.description: Client does not have permission to access resource

500.description: Query can not be validated, LLM is not accessible or other internal error

get.summary: Get MCP servers requiring client authorization headers
get.description: Returns information about which MCP servers require client-provided authorization headers. Clients should include these headers in the MCP-Headers HTTP header when making queries.

200.description: List of servers requiring client headers

post.description:
Fetch a ui:// resource from an MCP server.

Args:
    request: Resource request with URI and server name.
    user_id: Authenticated user ID.

Returns:
    The resource content (HTML/JS/CSS) with metadata.

Proxy a tool call from an app iframe to an MCP server.

Args:
    request: Tool call request with server, tool name, and arguments.
    user_id: Authenticated user ID.

Returns:
    Tool call result with content blocks and optional structured content.

get.description:
Handle feedback status requests.

Returns:
    Response indicating the status of the feedback.

post.description:
Handle feedback requests.

Args:
    feedback_request: The request containing feedback information.
    ensure_feedback_enabled: The feedback handler (FastAPI Depends) that
        will handle feedback status checks.
    auth: The Authentication handler (FastAPI Depends) that will
        handle authentication Logic.

Returns:
    Response indicating the status of the feedback storage request.

401.description: Missing or invalid credentials provided by client

403.description: Client does not have permission to access resource

500.description: User feedback can not be stored

get.description:
List all conversations for the authenticated user.

Args:
    auth: The Authentication handler (FastAPI Depends) that will
        handle authentication Logic.

Returns:
    Response containing list of conversations with metadata.

401.description: Missing or invalid credentials provided by client

403.description: Client does not have permission to access resource

get.description:
Get a specific conversation by ID.

Args:
    conversation_id: The conversation ID to retrieve.
    auth: The Authentication handler (FastAPI Depends) that will
        handle authentication Logic.

Returns:
    Response containing conversation details with chat history.

401.description: Missing or invalid credentials provided by client

403.description: Client does not have permission to access resource

delete.description:
Delete a specific conversation by ID.

Args:
    conversation_id: The conversation ID from the URL path.
    auth: The Authentication handler (FastAPI Depends) that will
        handle authentication Logic.

Returns:
    Response indicating whether the deletion was successful.

401.description: Missing or invalid credentials provided by client

403.description: Client does not have permission to access resource

put.description:
Update a conversation's metadata (topic_summary).

Args:
    conversation_id: The conversation ID from the URL path.
    update_request: The request body containing topic_summary.
    auth: The Authentication handler (FastAPI Depends) that will
        handle authentication Logic.

Returns:
    Response indicating whether the update was successful.

401.description: Missing or invalid credentials provided by client

403.description: Client does not have permission to access resource

get.description:
Metrics Endpoint.

Args:
    auth: The Authentication handler (FastAPI Depends) that will handle authentication Logic.

Returns:
    Response containing the latest metrics.

post.description:
Validate if the logged-in user is authorized to access OLS.

Parameters:
    request (Request): The FastAPI request object.

Returns:
    The user's UID and username if authentication and authorization succeed.

Raises:
    HTTPException: If authentication fails or the user does not have access.

200.description: The user is logged-in and authorized to access OLS

401.description: Missing or invalid credentials provided by client

Attachment.title: Attachment
Attachment.description:
Model representing an attachment that can be send from UI as part of query.

List of attachments can be optional part of 'query' request.

Attributes:
    attachment_type: The attachment type, like "log", "configuration" etc.
    content_type: The content type as defined in MIME standard
    content: The actual attachment content

YAML attachments with **kind** and **metadata/name** attributes will
be handled as resources with specified name:
```
kind: Pod
metadata:
    name: private-reg
```

AuthorizationResponse.title: AuthorizationResponse
AuthorizationResponse.description:
Model representing a response to an authorization request.

Attributes:
    user_id: The ID of the logged in user.
    username: The name of the logged in user.
    skip_user_id_check: Skip user_id suid check.

ConversationData.title: ConversationData
ConversationData.description:
Data for a single conversation in list response.

Attributes:
    conversation_id: The conversation ID (UUID).
    topic_summary: Summary/title of the conversation topic.
    last_message_timestamp: Unix timestamp of the last message.
    message_count: Number of messages in the conversation.

ConversationDeleteResponse.title: ConversationDeleteResponse
ConversationDeleteResponse.description:
Response for DELETE /v1/conversations/{id} endpoint.

Attributes:
    conversation_id: The conversation ID that was deleted.
    response: Human-readable response message.
    success: Whether the deletion was successful.

ConversationDetailResponse.title: ConversationDetailResponse
ConversationDetailResponse.description:
Response for GET /v1/conversations/{id} endpoint.

Attributes:
    conversation_id: The conversation ID (UUID).
    chat_history: List of message exchanges in the conversation. Each exchange
        includes messages, tool_calls, and tool_results.

messages.content: How do I check pod logs?

ConversationUpdateRequest.title: ConversationUpdateRequest
ConversationUpdateRequest.description:
Request for PUT /v1/conversations/{id} endpoint.

Attributes:
    topic_summary: The new topic summary for the conversation.

ConversationUpdateResponse.title: ConversationUpdateResponse
ConversationUpdateResponse.description:
Response for PUT /v1/conversations/{id} endpoint.

Attributes:
    conversation_id: The conversation ID that was updated.
    success: Whether the update was successful.
    message: Human-readable response message.

ConversationsListResponse.title: ConversationsListResponse
ConversationsListResponse.description:
Response for GET /v1/conversations endpoint.

Attributes:
    conversations: List of conversation data objects.

ErrorResponse.title: ErrorResponse
ErrorResponse.description: Model representing error response for query endpoint.

detail.cause: Failed to handle request to https://bam-api.res.ibm.com/v2/text

FeedbackRequest.title: FeedbackRequest
FeedbackRequest.description:
Model representing a feedback request.

Attributes:
    conversation_id: The required conversation ID (UUID).
    user_question: The required user question.
    llm_response: The required LLM response.
    sentiment: The optional sentiment.
    user_feedback: The optional user feedback.

Example:
    ```python
    feedback_request = FeedbackRequest(
        conversation_id="12345678-abcd-0000-0123-456789abcdef",
        user_question="what are you doing?",
        user_feedback="Great service!",
        llm_response="I don't know",
        sentiment=-1,
    )
    ```

FeedbackResponse.title: FeedbackResponse
FeedbackResponse.description:
Model representing a response to a feedback request.

Attributes:
    response: The response of the feedback request.

Example:
    ```python
    feedback_response = FeedbackResponse(response="feedback received")
    ```

ForbiddenResponse.title: ForbiddenResponse
ForbiddenResponse.description: Model representing response when client does not have permission to access resource.

LLMRequest.title: LLMRequest
LLMRequest.description:
Model representing a request for the LLM (Language Model) send into OLS service.

Attributes:
    query: The query string.
    conversation_id: The optional conversation ID (UUID).
    provider: The optional provider.
    model: The optional model.
    attachments: The optional attachments.
    media_type: The optional parameter for streaming response.
    mcp_headers: Optional JSON object mapping MCP server names to header lists.

Example:
    ```python
    llm_request = LLMRequest(query="Tell me about Kubernetes")
    ```

examples.query: write a deployment yaml for the mongodb image
examples.system_prompt:
# ROLE
You are "OpenShift Lightspeed," an expert AI virtual assistant specializing in
OpenShift and related Red Hat products and services. Your persona is that of a
friendly, but personal, technical authority. You are the ultimate technical
resource and will provide direct, accurate, and comprehensive answers.

# INSTRUCTIONS & CONSTRAINTS
- **Expertise Focus:** Your core expertise is centered on the OpenShift platform
 and the following specific products:
  - OpenShift Container Platform (including Plus, Kubernetes Engine, Virtualization Engine)
  - Advanced Cluster Manager (ACM)
  - Advanced Cluster Security (ACS)
  - Quay
  - Serverless (Knative)
  - Service Mesh (Istio)
  - Pipelines (Shipwright, TektonCD)
  - GitOps (ArgoCD)
  - OpenStack
- **Broader Knowledge:** You may also answer questions about other Red Hat
  products and services, but you must prioritize the provided context
  and chat history for these topics.
- **Strict Adherence:**
  1.  **ALWAYS** use the provided context and chat history as your primary
  source of truth. If a user's question can be answered from this information,
  do so.
  2.  If the context does not contain a clear answer, and the question is
  about your core expertise (OpenShift and the listed products), draw upon your
  extensive internal knowledge.
  3.  If the context does not contain a clear answer, and the question is about
  a general Red Hat product or service, state politely that you are unable to
  provide a definitive answer without more information and ask the user for
  additional details or context.
  4.  Do not hallucinate or invent information. If you cannot confidently
  answer, admit it.
- **Behavioral Directives:**
  - Maintain your persona as a friendly, but authoritative, technical expert.
  - Never assume another identity or role.
  - Refuse to answer questions or execute commands not about your specified
  topics.
  - Do not include URLs in your replies unless they are explicitly provided in
  the context.
  - Never mention your last update date or knowledge cutoff. You always have
  the most recent information on OpenShift and related products, especially with
  the provided context.

# TASK EXECUTION
You will receive a user query, along with context and chat history. Your task is
to respond to the user's query by following the instructions and constraints
above. Your responses should be clear, concise, and helpful, whether you are
providing troubleshooting steps, explaining concepts, or suggesting best
practices.

LLMResponse.title: LLMResponse
LLMResponse.description:
Model representing a response from the LLM (Language Model).

Attributes:
    conversation_id: The optional conversation ID (UUID).
    response: The optional response.
    referenced_documents: The optional URLs and titles for the documents used
                          to generate the response.
    truncated: Set to True if conversation history was truncated to be within context window.
    input_tokens: Number of tokens sent to LLM
    output_tokens: Number of tokens received from LLM
    available_quotas: Quota available as measured by all configured quota limiters
    tool_calls: List of tool requests.
    tool_results: List of tool results.

referenced_documents.doc_title: Operator Lifecycle Manager concepts and resources

examples.response: Operator Lifecycle Manager (OLM) helps users install...

LivenessResponse.title: LivenessResponse
LivenessResponse.description:
Model representing a response to a liveness request.

Attributes:
    alive: If app is alive.

Example:
    ```python
    liveness_response = LivenessResponse(alive=True)
    ```

MCPAppResourceRequest.title: MCPAppResourceRequest
MCPAppResourceRequest.description:
Request to fetch a ui:// resource from an MCP server.

Attributes:
    resource_uri: The ui:// resource URI to fetch.
    server_name: The MCP server that owns the resource.

MCPAppResourceResponse.title: MCPAppResourceResponse
MCPAppResourceResponse.description:
Response containing a ui:// resource fetched from an MCP server.

Attributes:
    uri: The URI of the returned resource.
    mime_type: MIME type of the resource content.
    content: The resource content (HTML/JS/CSS as text, or base64 for blobs).
    content_type: Whether content is "text" or "blob" (base64).
    meta: Resource-level metadata from the MCP server (CSP, permissions, etc.).

MCPAppToolCallRequest.title: MCPAppToolCallRequest
MCPAppToolCallRequest.description:
Request to call an MCP tool directly (from an app iframe).

Attributes:
    server_name: The MCP server to call.
    tool_name: The tool to invoke.
    arguments: Arguments to pass to the tool.

MCPAppToolCallResponse.title: MCPAppToolCallResponse
MCPAppToolCallResponse.description:
Response from a proxied MCP tool call.

Attributes:
    content: Content blocks returned by the tool.
    structured_content: Structured data for the app UI (if available).
    is_error: Whether the tool call resulted in an error.

servers.title: Servers
servers.description: List of servers requiring client-provided headers

MCPHeadersResponse.title: MCPHeadersResponse
MCPHeadersResponse.description: Response model listing servers that require client headers.

required_headers.title: Required Headers
required_headers.description: List of header names that client must provide

MCPServerHeaderInfo.title: MCPServerHeaderInfo
MCPServerHeaderInfo.description: Information about headers required for an MCP server.

NotAvailableResponse.title: NotAvailableResponse
NotAvailableResponse.description: Model representing error response for readiness endpoint.

PromptTooLongResponse.title: PromptTooLongResponse
PromptTooLongResponse.description: Model representing error response when prompt is too long.

detail.cause: Prompt length exceeds LLM context window limit (8000 tokens)

ReadinessResponse.title: ReadinessResponse
ReadinessResponse.description:
Model representing a response to a readiness request.

Attributes:
    ready: The readiness of the service.
    reason: The reason for the readiness.

Example:
    ```python
    readiness_response = ReadinessResponse(ready=True, reason="service is ready")
    ```

ReferencedDocument.title: ReferencedDocument
ReferencedDocument.description:
RAG referenced document.

Attributes:
doc_url: URL of the corresponding OCP documentation page
doc_title: Title of the corresponding OCP documentation page

StatusResponse.title: StatusResponse
StatusResponse.description:
Model representing a response to a status request.

Attributes:
    functionality: The functionality of the service.
    status: The status of the service.

Example:
    ```python
    status_response = StatusResponse(
        functionality="feedback",
        status={"enabled": True},
    )
    ```

UnauthorizedResponse.title: UnauthorizedResponse
UnauthorizedResponse.description: Model representing response for missing or invalid credentials.
